metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6414 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the vcard_apdu_new function in card_7816.c in libcacardbefore 2.5.3 allows local guest OS users to cause a denial of service (hostmemory consumption) via vectors related to allocating a new APDU object.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6414` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcacard0 - 2.5.0-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcacard package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.0-3').
